item.title: On _Sports Illustrated for Women_
item.description: One of the clear dividing lines in my life is the first time I received an issue of the magazine Sports Illustrated for Women in the mail. A sister magazine to the renowned sports monthly Sports Illustrated, SI for Women focused wholly on women’s sports, unlike any sports media (or women’s magazine!) that I had ever seen. Every cover featured one or more women athletes, and the magazine’s content covered an impressive variety of sports, as well as relevant topics for athletes, such as strength training, proper nutrition, and balancing training and life, all centered on women and their stories.
